6.text:
The Art Fund
and the Royal Museums Greenwich

9.text:
are fundraising
to save this magnificent picture,

13.text:
the Armada Portrait of Elizabeth,
for the nation.

16.text:
The painting was owned and perhaps
commissioned by Sir Francis Drake,

24.text:
The Spanish Armada was the response
of Philip II of Spain

29.text:
to repeated English aggression against the
Spanish empire, both abroad and at home.

36.text:
Philip decided to quell England,
once and for all, by sending the Armada.

42.text: And here it is at the top,

44.text:
maintaining this perfect crescent
of a defensive formation

48.text:
as it sails up the channel
towards the Spanish Netherlands.

52.text:
Suddenly, the wind,
which had been favourable,

58.text:
It blows them north, away from
their rendezvous in the Netherlands,

62.text:
right up the east coast of England,
and they flee before it.

66.text:
What had Elizabeth been doing
whilst the Armada was taking place?

70.text:
The truth is, she'd been desperately
hoping it would go away.

76.text: she puts on this magnificent public image

79.text:
and she delivers one of the great
set-piece speeches of her reign.

83.text:
"I have the body of
a weak and feeble woman,

87.text:
"but I have the heart and stomach of a
king — ay, and of a king of England, too."

94.text: But she'd no need to fight.

96.text:
Instead, here she sits
after the victory of her sailors

99.text: with her hand resting on the globe.

102.text: It is a prophesy of future and of empire.

108.text:
The campaign is going well,
but there's still some way to go.

112.text:
We need your help
to secure the future of the painting.

115.text: It's in a very fragile state.

121.text:
There's also the risk that if we fail
to raise the necessary 8.6 million,

127.text:
the painting will be sold
on the open market.

133.text: Help keep this great picture in Britain.

136.text:
Help bring it, for the first time
in its history of 425 years,

142.text:
into a public collection
where it can be enjoyed by everybody

148.text:
Please give generously.
As they say — every little helps.
